channel.title: Free GNU/Linux Distributions
channel.description: This RSS feed contains the current releases of free GNU/Linux distributions, as recognized by the FSF.

item.title: BLAG Linux and GNU
item.description: BLAG Linux and GNU, a GNU/Linux distribution based on Fedora.

item.title: Dragora 2.2 i486
item.description: Dragora, an independent GNU/Linux distribution based on concepts of simplicity.

item.title: Dragora 2.2 plus
item.description: Dragora, an independent GNU/Linux distribution based on concepts of simplicity.

item.title: Dragora 2.2 sources
item.description: Dragora, an independent GNU/Linux distribution based on concepts of simplicity.

item.title: Dragora 2.2 x86_64
item.description: Dragora, an independent GNU/Linux distribution based on concepts of simplicity.

item.title: Dynebolic 3.0.0-beta
item.description: Dynebolic, a GNU/Linux distribution with special emphasis on audio and video editing.

item.title: gNewSense livecd-deltah-i386-2.3
item.description: gNewSense, a GNU/Linux distribution based on Debian and Ubuntu, with sponsorship from the FSF.

item.title: Musix
item.description: Musix, a GNU+Linux distribution based on Knoppix, with special emphasis on audio production.

item.title: Parabola GNU/Linux 2012.10.17 dual
item.description: Parabola GNU/Linux, a distribution based on Arch that prioritizes simple package and system management.

item.title: Parabola GNU/Linux 20120912 mips64el
item.description: Parabola GNU/Linux, a distribution based on Arch that prioritizes simple package and system management.

item.description: Trisquel, a GNU/Linux distribution oriented toward small enterprises, domestic users and educational centers.

item.title: Ututo XS
item.description: Ututo XS, a GNU/Linux distribution based on Gentoo. It was the first fully free GNU/Linux system recognized by the GNU Project.
